Why do some antivirus programs like Avast and Kaspersky flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus programs may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it is mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit a user's PC. This is a false positive, and the software is not malicious. You can review the resources provided to learn more about these false positives.
